events.name: Deadly cold weather in Asia
events.wd_description: Extreme cold weather was recorded in several Asian countries, including Japan, China, and the Korean peninsula, leading to fatalities and significant disruptions.
events.description: Extreme cold weather was recorded in several Asian countries, including Japan, China, and the Korean peninsula, leading to fatalities and significant disruptions.

events.name: Japan cold weather
events.wd_description: Deadly cold weather in Japan resulted in fatalities and caused the cancellation of hundreds of domestic flights due to heavy snow and high winds.
events.description: Deadly cold weather in Japan resulted in fatalities and caused the cancellation of hundreds of domestic flights due to heavy snow and high winds.

events.name: Korean peninsula cold weather
events.wd_description: The Korean peninsula experienced cold storms with temperatures dropping as low as -22°F (-30°C), particularly affecting the Pyongyang province.
events.description: The Korean peninsula experienced cold storms with temperatures dropping as low as -22°F (-30°C), particularly affecting the Pyongyang province.

events.name: China cold weather
events.wd_description: China's northernmost city, Mohe, recorded its lowest temperature ever at -63.4°F (-53°C), with significant temperature reductions predicted in several areas.
events.description: China's northernmost city, Mohe, recorded its lowest temperature ever at -63.4°F (-53°C), with significant temperature reductions predicted in several areas.

events.name: Ukraine Set to Receive Over 300 Tanks from Western Countries
events.wd_label: Ukraine Set to Receive Over 300 Tanks from Western Countries
events.wd_description: Ukraine's ambassador to France announced that more than 300 tanks would be delivered to Ukraine from Western countries, following commitments from the US and Germany, despite criticism from North Korea and Russia.
events.description: Ukraine's ambassador to France announced that more than 300 tanks would be delivered to Ukraine from Western countries, following commitments from the US and Germany, despite criticism from North Korea and Russia.

events.name: Announcement of Tank Deliveries
events.wd_description: Kyiv's ambassador to France, Vadym Omelchenko, stated that Ukraine would receive 321 tanks from various Western countries to bolster its defense against Russia.
events.description: Kyiv's ambassador to France, Vadym Omelchenko, stated that Ukraine would receive 321 tanks from various Western countries to bolster its defense against Russia.

events.name: US and Germany Tank Commitments
events.wd_description: The US committed to delivering 31 M1 Abrams tanks, and Germany agreed to provide 14 Leopard 2 A6 tanks to Ukraine, contributing to the total number of tanks pledged.
events.description: The US committed to delivering 31 M1 Abrams tanks, and Germany agreed to provide 14 Leopard 2 A6 tanks to Ukraine, contributing to the total number of tanks pledged.

events.name: North Korea's Criticism
events.wd_description: North Korea, through Kim Yo Jong, criticized the US and its allies for supplying tanks to Ukraine, accusing them of undermining global and regional security.
events.description: North Korea, through Kim Yo Jong, criticized the US and its allies for supplying tanks to Ukraine, accusing them of undermining global and regional security.

events.name: US Drone Crashes into Black Sea After Encounter with Russian Fighter Jet
events.wd_label: US Drone Crashes into Black Sea After Encounter with Russian Fighter Jet
events.wd_description: A US MQ-9 Reaper drone crashed into the Black Sea after being damaged by a Russian fighter jet during a routine operation in international airspace, leading to tensions between the US and Russia.
events.description: A US MQ-9 Reaper drone crashed into the Black Sea after being damaged by a Russian fighter jet during a routine operation in international airspace, leading to tensions between the US and Russia.

events.name: Drone Incident
events.wd_description: A US MQ-9 Reaper drone was intercepted by a Russian fighter jet during routine operations in international airspace, leading to a collision that damaged the drone's propeller and caused it to crash into the Black Sea.
events.description: A US MQ-9 Reaper drone was intercepted by a Russian fighter jet during routine operations in international airspace, leading to a collision that damaged the drone's propeller and caused it to crash into the Black Sea.

events.name: US Military Statement
events.wd_description: Air Force Gen. James B. Hecker, commander of the U.S. Air Force Europe and Air Force Africa, confirmed that the MQ-9 drone was conducting routine operations when it was intercepted and hit by a Russian aircraft, resulting in the crash.
events.description: Air Force Gen. James B. Hecker, commander of the U.S. Air Force Europe and Air Force Africa, confirmed that the MQ-9 drone was conducting routine operations when it was intercepted and hit by a Russian aircraft, resulting in the crash.

events.name: Russian Response
events.wd_description: Russian Ambassador to the US, Anatoly Antonov, stated that Russia does not seek confrontation with the US after being summoned to the State Department following the drone incident.
events.description: Russian Ambassador to the US, Anatoly Antonov, stated that Russia does not seek confrontation with the US after being summoned to the State Department following the drone incident.

events.name: Uncertainty Over Drone Recovery
events.wd_description: The National Security Council communications coordinator expressed uncertainty over whether the US will be able to recover the downed MQ-9 Reaper drone from the Black Sea.
events.description: The National Security Council communications coordinator expressed uncertainty over whether the US will be able to recover the downed MQ-9 Reaper drone from the Black Sea.

events.name: EV Battery Supply Chain and Logistics
events.wd_label: EV Battery Supply Chain and Logistics
events.wd_description: The automotive industry's supply chain for metals, plastics, and parts is adapting to the demands of electric vehicle (EV) batteries, involving unique logistics for lithium-ion battery components and raw materials.
events.description: The automotive industry's supply chain for metals, plastics, and parts is adapting to the demands of electric vehicle (EV) batteries, involving unique logistics for lithium-ion battery components and raw materials.

events.name: Current Supply Chain Overview
events.wd_description: The supply chain for EV batteries involves multiple stages, from raw material extraction to shipping finished batteries and vehicles, and is critical for meeting increasing EV demand.
events.description: The supply chain for EV batteries involves multiple stages, from raw material extraction to shipping finished batteries and vehicles, and is critical for meeting increasing EV demand.

events.name: Lithium-Ion Battery Components
events.wd_description: Lithium-ion batteries consist of lithium-ion cells, wires, a battery management system, and a casing, with cells grouped into modules and multiple modules forming the battery pack.
events.description: Lithium-ion batteries consist of lithium-ion cells, wires, a battery management system, and a casing, with cells grouped into modules and multiple modules forming the battery pack.

events.name: t: Anode
events.wd_description: The anode, or negative electrode, is most often made of graphite.
events.description: The anode, or negative electrode, is most often made of graphite.

events.name: t: Cathode
events.wd_description: The cathode, or positive electrode, can be made of lithium cobalt oxide, lithium iron phosphate, or lithium manganese oxide.
events.description: The cathode, or positive electrode, can be made of lithium cobalt oxide, lithium iron phosphate, or lithium manganese oxide.

events.name: t: Electrolyte
events.wd_description: The electrolyte transports positive lithium-ions between the anode and cathode, with lithium salt being the most common electrolyte.
events.description: The electrolyte transports positive lithium-ions between the anode and cathode, with lithium salt being the most common electrolyte.

events.name: t: Separator
events.wd_description: The separator is a thin sheet of material between the cathode and anode that controls ion flow to prevent electrical shorts, typically made from polyolefin.
events.description: The separator is a thin sheet of material between the cathode and anode that controls ion flow to prevent electrical shorts, typically made from polyolefin.

events.name: Shipping Raw Materials for Lithium Mining
events.wd_label: Shipping Raw Materials for Lithium Mining
events.wd_description: The raw materials for lithium mining, including caustic soda, sodium cyanide, nitric acid, cobalt, and graphite, are shipped to lithium mines by truck or rail.
events.description: The raw materials for lithium mining, including caustic soda, sodium cyanide, nitric acid, cobalt, and graphite, are shipped to lithium mines by truck or rail.

events.name: Shipping Lithium Carbonate to Lithium Hydroxide Producers
events.wd_label: Shipping Lithium Carbonate to Lithium Hydroxide Producers
events.wd_description: After processing lithium chloride into lithium carbonate, it is shipped to facilities in the U.S. or China for further processing into lithium hydroxide.
events.description: After processing lithium chloride into lithium carbonate, it is shipped to facilities in the U.S. or China for further processing into lithium hydroxide.

events.name: Shipping Battery Cell Components
events.wd_description: Materials to make battery cell components, such as lithium carbonate and lithium hydroxide, are shipped to Asia where cathodes, anodes, electrolytes, and separators are produced.
events.description: Materials to make battery cell components, such as lithium carbonate and lithium hydroxide, are shipped to Asia where cathodes, anodes, electrolytes, and separators are produced.

events.name: Shipping Battery Cells to Manufacturers
events.wd_description: After producing lithium-ion battery cells in Asia, they are imported back to the U.S. for use by battery module and pack producers.
events.description: After producing lithium-ion battery cells in Asia, they are imported back to the U.S. for use by battery module and pack producers.

events.name: Shipping Finished Batteries to OEMs
events.wd_description: Battery modules are assembled into battery packs, which are then shipped to original equipment manufacturers (OEMs).
events.description: Battery modules are assembled into battery packs, which are then shipped to original equipment manufacturers (OEMs).

events.name: Shipping EVs to End Markets
events.wd_description: Once EV batteries are installed in vehicles, the finished electric vehicles are shipped to dealerships or other end markets for sale to consumers.
events.description: Once EV batteries are installed in vehicles, the finished electric vehicles are shipped to dealerships or other end markets for sale to consumers.

events.name: Battery Recycling
events.wd_description: At the end of their useful life, EV batteries can be recycled, with materials like cobalt, lithium, manganese, nickel, and graphite being reused in new batteries.
events.description: At the end of their useful life, EV batteries can be recycled, with materials like cobalt, lithium, manganese, nickel, and graphite being reused in new batteries.
